explanation: The report is not correct as stated. While the pointers are only used for traversal (they are not used to modify the pointed MHD_Connection objects), posn cannot be made const in isolation because it is assigned to pos (pos = posn) in the loop update. Declaring posn as const struct MHD_Connection *posn; would make the assignment pos = posn invalid (dropping const) unless pos itself were also changed to point to const. The real, minimal MISRA-friendly change would be to make both loop variables point to const-qualified types (e.g. const struct MHD_Connection *pos, *posn) if that fits the rest of the codebase; that preserves the intent (read-only traversal) and satisfies Rule 8.13. As written, however, the single-variable complaint about posn is incomplete/incorrect, so the reported violation is not correct.
